controller.abstracts

Interface Controller

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddPlaneController, AirportInfoController, LoginScreenController, MapController, PlaneInfoController, PlaneListController, RegisterController

    public interface Controller
    Controller interface that is implemented by every controller class except Main and AirTraffic. It implements method initialize which is essential for FXML Controllers as well as methods for switching scenes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initialize() 
      default void switchScene(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane currentScene, java.lang.String scene)
      Deletes all children from currentScene and adds children from view scene to the currentScene.
      default void switchToMap(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane currentScene, Storage storage)
      Deletes all children from currentScene and adds children from view Map to the currentScene.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize()

      • switchToMap

        default void switchToMap(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane currentScene,
                         Storage storage)
        Deletes all children from currentScene and adds children from view Map to the currentScene. Also sets (loads) helper class Storage. Storage is used to move ArrayLists, airports and planes, between different controllers.
        Parameters:
        currentScene - main scene that is used to display elements on the screen
        storage - helper class that holds ArrayLists of classes Airport and Plane

      • switchScene

        default void switchScene(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane currentScene,
                         java.lang.String scene)
        Deletes all children from currentScene and adds children from view scene to the currentScene.
        Parameters:
        currentScene - scene used by controller that called this method
        scene - specifies name of view that should be displayed
